frameDefinitions: This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.
Procedural or Medicine based Interventions are used on a Patient to attempt to alleviate a Medical_condition.
This frame includes words that name medical specialties and is closely related to the Medical_professionals frame.
This frame includes words that name medical professionals and is closely related to the Medical_specialties frame.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
frameExamples: Isis then <t>cured</t> Re by reciting a spell.
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
listRoleDefinitions: The  Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs:

This   is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of  role Conflation:  (See section on Conflation.)
The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above:
The role Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1.
The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient.
The <fen>Body_part</fen> is the specific area of the <fen>Patient</fen>'s body which is treated.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
A drug or procedure is administered or performed in order to treat a <fen>Medical_condition</fen>.
The consequence of the <fen>Intervention</fen>.
A holistic description of the medical state of the patient (or a part of the state of the patient), which may or may not indicate the cause of a deviation from normal.
The individual or team that attempts to improve the medical condition of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the medical <fen>Specialty</fen> that someone practices.
This role identifies the medical <fen>Professional</fen>.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
